official-title.#text: To provide for the transfer of naval vessels to certain foreign countries, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text: Transfer of naval vessels to certain foreign recipients

text.#text: The President is authorized to transfer vessels to foreign countries on a grant basis under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 516 of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961

text.#text: To the Government of Mexico, the OLIVER HAZARD PERRY class guided missile frigates USS CURTS (FFG–38) and USS MCCLUSKY (FFG–41).
To the Government of Thailand, the OLIVER HAZARD PERRY class guided missile frigates USS RENTZ (FFG–46) and USS VANDEGRIFT (FFG–48).

The President is authorized to transfer the OLIVER HAZARD PERRY class guided missile frigates USS TAYLOR (FFG–50), USS GARY (FFG–51), USS CARR (FFG–52), and USS ELROD (FFG–55) to the Taipei Economic and Cultural Representative Office of the United States (which is the Taiwan instrumentality designated pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 10(a) of the Taiwan Relations Act
section 21 of the Arms Export Control Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Naval Vessel Transfer and Arms Export Control Amendments Act of 2013/s:101/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to transfer specific vessels to specific countries, the President is authorized, subject to the same conditions that would apply for such country under this Act, to transfer any vessel named in this Act to any country named in this Act such that the total number of vessels transferred to such country does not exceed the total number of vessels authorized for transfer to such country by this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Naval Vessel Transfer and Arms Export Control Amendments Act of 2013/s:101/ss:b
Naval Vessel Transfer and Arms Export Control Amendments Act of 2013/s:101/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall not be counted against the aggregate value of excess defense articles transferred in any fiscal year under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Naval Vessel Transfer and Arms Export Control Amendments Act of 2013/s:101/ss:c

text.#text: The value of a vessel transferred to another country on a grant basis pursuant to authority provided by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 516 of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961

header.#text: Grants not counted in annual total of transferred excess defense articles

text.#text: Any expense incurred by the United States in connection with a transfer authorized by this section shall be charged to the recipient notwithstanding

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 516(e) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall require, as a condition of the transfer of a vessel under this section, that the recipient to which the vessel is transferred have such repair or refurbishment of the vessel as is needed, before the vessel joins the naval forces of that recipient, performed at a shipyard located in the United States, including a United States Navy shipyard.

text.#text: To the maximum extent practicable, the

header.#text: Repair and refurbishment in united states shipyards

text.#text: The authority to transfer a vessel under this section shall expire at the end of the 3-year period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act.

header.#text: Requirements for removal of major defense equipment and significant military equipment from the united states munitions list

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 38(f) of the Arms Export Control Act

header.#text: Notification and reporting requirements for major defense equipment and significant military equipment removed from the united states munitions list

text.#text: The President shall ensure that any item that is major defense equipment or significant military equipment and is removed from the United States Munitions List shall continue to be subject to the notification and reporting requirements of the following provisions of law:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 516(f) of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961
